message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on a cloud-based radio access network (C-RAN) architecture for future cellular networks, which involves the use of fronthaul to connect multiple distributed remote radio units (RRHs) to a centralized location. This falls under the domain of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with optimizing the joint CoMP-cell selection and base station resource allocation subject to fronthaul capacity constraints in an OFDMA-based C-RAN. This involves the use of information theory concepts and techniques for efficient resource allocation.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a solution method for optimizing the time-frequency resource allocation problem without loss of fairness on the QoS enhancement of all users. This involves the use of control theory concepts and techniques for efficient resource allocation.
4. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper deals with the centralization of signal processing in a C-RAN architecture, which involves distributed, parallel, and cluster computing techniques for efficient signal processing.
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper focuses on enhancing the quality of service (QoS) in a C-RAN architecture, which involves the use of multimedia techniques for efficient resource allocation and signal processing.
